definition: to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: Michael confronts Roland about setting them up, but he denies it.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾逼問是否羅蘭德出賣了他們，他抵死不認。

sentences.english: Question closely under, yang Silang said frankly eventually oneself true identity.
sentences.chinese: 逼問之下，楊四郎終於坦言了自己的真實身份。

sentences.english: Pope grills nurse Katie about the infirmary door being unlocked.
sentences.chinese: 獄長逼問護士Katie，爲何醫務室的門沒有鎖。

sentences.english: Chin Hua princess merely also have not repeatedly continue to compel to ask her, silently corner round to walk.
sentences.chinese: 清華郡主卻也沒再繼續逼問她，默默地轉身走了。

sentences.english: Every injury accident about students is all relation with the administration responsibility of the school.
sentences.chinese: 每一起學生傷害事故都會最終逼問學校的管理責任。

definition: to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
to lay one's cards on the table
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
